911624223:
[

Senior Payroll Analyst

Company Name The Star Entertainment Group Company Location Pyrmont

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us:


The Star Entertainment Group is a top 100 ASX listed company, comprising of exquisite hotels and spas; exhilarating gaming spaces; award-winning bars and restaurants. While all these remarkable facilities are meaningful to our vision to be Australia’s leading integrated resort company, alone they will not make us extraordinary. For this, we need the very best people to bring the thrill of it all to life and improve the experience. This is an exciting time to join our Group, with the transformation of our properties, including plans for eight new hotels, more than 70 new restaurants and bars and a variety of other new entertainment venues – do not miss this opportunity!


The role:


Reporting to the Payroll Manager and joining a close-knit team of 10, this is a newly built role focused on providing end to end ownership with payroll and will see you become the teams subject matter expert in compliance activities and reporting and analysis for the payroll team. The primary function of this role is ensuring accurate and timely remittances of third party payroll deduction and payments, including PAYG, Superannuation, and Payroll Tax across the Group, and statutory payroll reporting as well as external payroll data management and analysis. In the future this role also has the intent to have an analyst reporting into this structure and offers lengthy career development for you offering leadership growth opportunities.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:


  • Prepare superannuation, payroll tax and other third-party reconciliation and payment as part of month end process
  • Prepare PAYG reconciliations and payments as per legislative requirement on a timely basis
  • External and internal payroll related reporting and analytical responsibilities and stakeholder management
  • Be the point of contact for updates and training as required for the team on internal or externally driven changes (EA arrangements, legislative or super changes)
  • Perform user acceptance testing on compliance and superannuation system changes
  • Represent the team as lead for regular audits or enquiries

Required Skills & Experience:


  • Relevant tertiary qualifications or work experience
  • Considerable end to end experience working in a large corporate payroll function (1000 or more employees) in both a Salaried and Award environment
  • Strongly developed system skills a(ERP/Word/Excel) and experience using Oracle as a payroll system is helpful
  • Seeking a dedicated teammate with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Proven analytical & problem-solving skills
  • Understanding of laws as they relate to the organisation, in particular, ATO regulations, and financial statutory requirements

Our ideal profile:


At seasoned payroll professional that loves to tackle problem and shape the way we do things. You will bring hands on experience in leading payroll processes to support the wider team and in turn become our SME! You will be used to fast paced and dynamic environment.


Sound like you? We'd love to hear from you! Apply now via the link to be part of our passionate team


\xa0

There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more. And it’s why we’re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here, the world’s brightest minds are tackling the world’s biggest challenges. RIGHT NOW.

Title: 50794926 - RDC Operations Supervisor - 47906
Primary Location: Australia (AU) - Victoria (AU-VIC) - Derrimut
Personnel Area: 2300 - JD Limited - Australia
Function: Operations
Job Grade: 07
Hiring Manager: Andrew (Andy) S Tomkins

Purpose

Your Position:

Manages the five core operations processes of Inbound, Outbound, Inventory, Facilities and HR/IR processes within the facility. While focusing on the how and utilising continuous improvement initiatives ensure the continued achievement of Safety, Quality, Productivity and Financial goals. Ensures processes, policies and standards and deployed to ensure compliance to meet legal and enterprise standards. Openly communicates with all parties to maintain a highly aligned team, focused on our customer.

Duties
  • Manages the core process assigned, and supports other supervisors and staff in their assigned processes
  • Directs, leads and develops an engaged workforce
  • Supervises and provides work direction to the warehouse team on a daily basis and leads the development and execution of goals within assigned work teams
  • Ensures all activities are undertaken safely, ensuring quality and productivity targets are met and business process, policies and reporting are complied with
  • Responsible for the production of accurate and timely data and reporting for payroll and bonus systems, holds their direct reports accountable for their time and attendance

    • Knowledge of shop floor manufacturing and/or warehouse and distribution production pay systems.
    • Knowledge of manufacturing and/or distribution processes, quality, tooling, tool design, total preventative maintenance and facilities.
    • Understanding of Lean Manufacturing, Just-in Time, Kanban, Demand Flow Technology.
    • Knowledge of products, customers, markets and competitors.


    Work Experiences

    Type and amount of experience necessary to perform the essential functions of the job. May include specific roles and/or an understanding of a particular function, organization, industry or product line.
    • Demonstrated team leadership and mentoring experience, 4 -7 years
    • Minimum 3 - 4 years’ experience as a warehouse supervisor
    • In depth understanding and experience of the core warehouse functions of inbound, outbound, inventory control, facilities and HR/IR processes
    • Ability to create, lead and motivate a team
    • Highly developed planning, reporting and project management skills
    • Advanced communication skills, ability to foster and work in a highly aligned team
    • Able to facilitate change management
    • Focussed on Safety, Quality and Productivity with a track record of achieving all
    • Demonstrated introduction and execution of CI and 5S processes

    Applications for this position will close at COB Friday 19th October 2018.

Company Name Affinity Sports & Education Limited Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Job description

Dear Teacher, we need you!

About Our Centre

Welcome to Casey Childcare & Kindergarten! Our busy and vibrant 120-place centre includes a wonderful and highly dedicated team of early childhood professionals - and they are ready to give you a warm welcome! We embrace our local community by connecting with local businesses, events, charities, schools and services to enrich the early education of the children in our care. We're proud to have been rated as Meeting the National Quality Standards, and our dedicated Quality Advisor continuously supports us to further develop our centre. Every day is full of fun and learning, as we inspire each child in our care to reach their full potential.Find out more about our centre - just Google our centre name to find our website and Facebook page!

The role

Passionate about early childhood education? Seeking a centre which truly values their ECT? We’ve got the right role for you!

Our childhood centre is a thriving part of our local community. The role encourages the teacher to help our children develop a lifelong love of learning through child-led enquiry, connections to our local primary school and positive experiences within our community.

Essential to the role are creativity, understanding of individual needs and skill in delivering programs which meet the Early Years Learning Framework and interest in facilitating the growth and development of other educators.

There are opportunities to design, implement and evaluate educational programs for our children, allowing for the unique and individual interests and strengths of each child.

As part of our centre, you’ll also be a part of a national network of Early Childhood Teachers working in more than 160 pre-school or kindergarten classrooms around Australia. Enjoy the opportunities Affinity provides for you to meet, collaborate, share and inspire. You’ll be invited to participate in regular professional development opportunities, engagement with our Quality Team, and play an active role in a company which is committed to delivering educational excellence during the most important years for learning in children’s lives.

About You
  • A natural, warm and enthusiastic leader ready to motivate a team of educators
  • Dedicated to creating friendly, caring and active learning environments
  • Proven ability to build and nurture respectful and mutually-beneficial partnerships with parents and families Genuine desire to maximise children’s love of learning
  • Experienced in managing daily care routines, and associated administrative and compliance tasks
  • Experienced in maintaining health and safety standards, and risk minimisation

Your reward
  • A permanent part-time role (up to 37.5-hours per week) working for Australia’s fastest-growing child care group
  • Term Time (4 weeks paid annual leave, with the option for additional unpaid leave to work in with school terms
  • Membership in ECT Connect – Affinity’s national Early Childhood Teacher network
  • Extensive knowledge of the Early Years Learning Framework
  • Commitment to leading the centre to Meet and Exceed the National Quality Standards
  • Incentive program - earn brand new resources for your centre
  • Leadership, management and training opportunities to develop your career further
  • Access to discounts on a variety of products and services
  • Access to a national network of colleagues, training and future job opportunities at more than 160 child care centres owned by the same company

You already have
  • An Early Childhood Degree or ACECQA-approved equivalent (or currently studying with 50% completion minimum)
  • Experience developing portfolios for each child
  • A current Working with Children’s Check or equivalent
  • Strong and positive communication, leadership and management skills
  • Current driver’s licence, first aid certificate (including asthma and anaphylactic training) and resuscitation certificate

Why work for Affinity?

At Affinity, we proudly do things differently. Our mission is to inspire and nurture individuals to reach their full potential. It isn’t just about what we do for children, it’s about what we do for our team, too. Every day, at more than 160 child care centres around Australia, we support quality, teamwork, training opportunities and a culture of recognition and reward. Affinity allows our people to shine – so we can deliver the best in early education.

As Australia’s most dynamic early learning business, we’re revolutionising our industry through our Lifelong Learning approach, Quality Team, Healthy Children program, technology and facilities upgrades and much more. We’d love you to join us!

Achieve beyond your expectations as you are supported to learn, grow personally and professionally and develop new, valuable skills.

Feel positive. Feel proud. Make new friends. Laugh. Go home smiling.

MAKE YOUR MOVE

Apply Now.

The Connecting Care program will see the expansion of the successful Royal Children’s Hospital (RCH) Epic EMR to operate across the four health services.
